story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in Indonesia, there was a kind and curious little girl named Sari. Sari lived with her mother and father in a cozy house near a lush jungle.

One day, Sari's mother told her a story about a magical bird that lived deep in the jungle. The bird was said to have beautiful feathers that sparkled in the sunlight and a melodious song that could be heard from miles away. Intrigued, Sari asked her mother if they could go on a journey to find the magical bird.

The next morning, Sari and her mother packed some food and water and set off into the jungle. As they walked deeper into the jungle, Sari's mother taught her about the different plants and animals that they encountered. Sari was fascinated by all the new things she was learning.

After several hours of walking, Sari and her mother finally heard the magical bird's song. They followed the sound until they came upon a clearing in the jungle. There, perched on a branch, was the most beautiful bird Sari had ever seen. Its feathers shimmered in the sunlight and its song was even more enchanting than Sari could have imagined.

Sari and her mother sat in awe of the magical bird for what seemed like hours. As the sun began to set, Sari's mother told her that it was time to start heading back home. Sari was reluctant to leave, but she knew that they had to.

As they were walking back home, Sari turned to her mother and asked, "Mother, why is the bird so magical?"

Her mother smiled and replied, "The bird is magical because it brings joy and wonder to those who are lucky enough to hear its song. And now, my dear Sari, you too have experienced the magic of the bird's song. Never forget this special moment and always remember to cherish the beauty and wonder of nature."

Sari nodded, feeling grateful for the amazing adventure she had just experienced. From that day on, Sari always remembered the magical bird and the lessons her mother taught her about the beauty and wonder of the natural world.

As Sari drifted off to sleep that night, she smiled, knowing that she had a wonderful story to tell her friends and family when she returned home. And she knew that she would always carry the memory of the magical bird in her heart.

The end.

Goodnight my dear, sweet dreams.
